itemDescription: Chief police adviser to the Ministry of the Interior, Iraq

wikipedia_page.main: Douglas Brand OBE (born April 28, 1951) is a British  criminologist and retired police officer who was tasked with assisting with the establishment of the newly formed Iraqi Police in the aftermath of the 2003 invasion of Iraq.

response: After a recess to avoid influencing the general election, the inquiry resumed public hearings on 29 June 2010. The first witness was Douglas Brand, chief police adviser to the Iraqi Interior Ministry from 2003 to 2005.
